statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: The Dallas Mavericks were short-handed against the Chicago Bulls. It turned out the Mavericks had more than enough offense to win.
article.headline: Finley, Eschmeyer both go down, but Mavs roll
article.linkText: Despite a pair of injuries, Mavs overpower Bulls
article.story:
DALLAS (AP) -- The Dallas Mavericks were short-handed against the Chicago Bulls. It turned out the Mavericks had more than enough offense to win. Dirk Nowitzki scored 21 of his 24 points in the first quarter, and Dallas' reserves scored 42 points as the Mavericks cruised to an 89-74 victory and stretched their season-high winning streak to eight. The Mavericks were without No. 2 scorer Michael Finley and starting center Evan Eschmeyer, both sidelined with first-half injuries. "It took some adjusting," Mavericks coach Don Nelson said after his 999th career victory. "Playing without our best player, we did the best we could." Nelson said Finley's hamstring injury was a carryover from the victory Wednesday night at San Antonio, but the Mavericks don't expect Finley to miss any games. As for Eschmeyer's sprained left ankle, Nelson said, "I hope it's not too bad, but I think it probably is." Dallas reserve Eduardo Najera set career highs with 15 points and 14 rebounds. Steve Nash had nine points and a season-high 14 assists, and Juwan Howard added 11 points for Dallas, which last won eight consecutive during the 1987-88 season when the Mavericks won 11 in a row. "It was Najera to the rescue," Nelson said. "He just continues to get better and better." Najera hit all seven field-goal attempts and had five offensive rebounds and three steals to spark the Mavericks. "I played solid," said Najera, who has become one of the Mavericks' first players off the bench after starting the season 11th or 12th in Dallas' rotation. "There was nothing fancy. I just did my job. (Nelson) told us he was going to rely on the bench tonight and we took it as a challenge." Ron Mercer scored 19 points and Ron Artest 13 for the Bulls, who lost their eighth in a row and 16th consecutive on the road. Chicago interim coach Bill Berry fell to 0-2 since taking over after coach Tim Floyd's resignation on Christmas Eve. Chicago is a league-worst 4-23. In the opening quarter, Nowitzki shot 6-for-7 from the field, hit all three 3-pointers and converted all six free throws as the Mavericks built a 32-20 lead entering the second quarter. "I had a lot of good looks, made a couple open shots, layups and dunks," Nowitzki said. "We were playing great defense and running the ball real well." Berry made some defensive adjustments on Nowitzki after his strong first quarter. "Nowitzki went crazy in the first quarter," Berry said. "He had a great quarter. He's a heck of a player. But after that, Ron Artest did a pretty good job on him." Finley left with 8:46 in the first quarter after straining his left hamstring while running downcourt on offense, and did not return. Finley's three minutes were the fewest of his career. He played nine minutes in a game against Houston on Dec. 19, 1995, while a member of the Phoenix Suns. Eschmeyer sprained his left ankle running downcourt on offense and was done for the night with 8:49 remaining in the second quarter. The Bulls reduced the deficit to 43-34 at halftime after the Mavericks had an 11-point second quarter, their lowest quarter of the season. Chicago got as close as 45-40 early in the third quarter, but Nash scored nine of Dallas' next 16 points to help the Mavericks increase their lead to 61-51. Dallas led 63-56 going into the fourth quarter. Game notes
Chicago finished with the lowest points total by a Dallas opponent this season. The previous low was 78 by Charlotte. ... Dallas' 11 points in the second quarter were the fewest allowed by Chicago in any quarter this season. ... Nowitzki's first-quarter outburst left him three points short of tying Mark Aguirre's club record for points in a quarter. Aguirre scored 24 points in a quarter in the 1983-84 season. ... The game drew 20,018, the second-largest home crowd in Mavericks history. ... The Mavericks scored less than 100 points for the first time in their eight-game winning streak.
